vWashington House Rabbit Newsv

Volume 6 Issue 4 December 1997

ALL I WANT FOR
CHRISTMAS. . .is a home

MAX is a very cute, but very shy, Netherland Dwarf born approximately April of 1997. He arrived at HRS in poor condition with abcesses and no fur on his backside from fighting. His caretakers neglected to consider neutering two sexually mature male rabbits before putting them together. As a result, one rabbit died from fighting, while Max was rescued from the home. Today, Max is fully recovered from his injuries and has looks that would melt anyone's heart. Max loves large paper bags to play in. Caretakers that are very willing to spend time with him is best as he (very understandably) is still learning to trust people. 

PEPPER is a darling little girl with a craving for lots of affection. She always in the front of her cage at the HRS Adoption Center just waiting for someone to give pets and kisses. Pepper will make a great companion for another house bun. She's very curious and will greet anyone indiscriminantly with lots of affection. Pepper was born approximately January of 1996.

 

BEA is a large French Lop whose size shouldn't intimidate you, she's actually a big silly sweetie. She will sit for as long as you can pet her (which could be a very long time). Bea is from the Seattle Animal Control, and was born approximately July of 1996

 

BLIZZARD AND HAILEY are beautiful White New Zealands. They're a bit shy, but with time, they are slowly becoming used to people. They were born approximately in January of 1997 and rescued from the King County Animal control.

 

WILLIE, KIKI, and MINNIE, were rescued as feral babies. They were born on April 27, 1997. ANGELO (very right in picture) is a Hotot and was rescued from the King County Animal Control. All are loads of energy. A home with lots of room to run around is most ideal for each.
